intro: Phyteuma pyrenaicum f. glabrum, commonly known as the smoothleaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
